Dear Mr. Whitney:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
4/27/-4/30/20. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and ISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your contract.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions;
initial treatment plan.

following:
(d) Indicators of goal achievement.
Three resident files were reviewed. One out of three files did not
have indicators that correlated with goal achievement.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
Seventeen new employee records were reviewed. One out of
seventeen did not have all three references obtained before
employment.
REPEAT VIOLATION: RENEWAL 2019
R 400.4113 Employee records.

(g) If the employee has criminal convictions, the
institution shall complete a written evaluation of the
convictions that addresses the nature of the conviction, the

determining suitability for employment in the institution.
Seventeen new employee records were reviewed. One out of
seventeen did not have the institution’s written evaluation
completed before employment. The employee was hired on
2/19/20 and the assessment was completed on 2/21/20.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(4) Training opportunities for direct care staff shall include,
but are not limited to, all of the following:
(g) Proper and safe methods and techniques of restraint
